name: Calamity Queller
desc: A keenly honed weapon forged from some strange crystal. Its faint blue light seems to whisper of countless matters now past.

customize.name: Azurelight
customize.desc: This blade was once pure and pristine as a white dawn star, but it has since been tinted a deep, dark blue.

customize.name: Calamity Queller
customize.desc: A keenly honed weapon forged from some strange crystal. Its faint blue light seems to whisper of countless matters now past.

customize.name: Sacrificial Bow
customize.desc: A ceremonial hunting bow that has become petrified over time. The trinkets on it are still visible. It grants the wielder the power to withstand the winds of time.

customize.name: Xiphos' Moonlight
customize.desc: This ancient double-edged sword glimmers with moonlight. It is said that a now-silent Jinni dwells within it.

customize.name: Wandering Evenstar
customize.desc: This was originally a device used by researchers to observe and perform calculations on celestial phenomena. It serves as a conduit and catalyst.

customize.name: Favonius Lance
customize.desc: A polearm made in the style of the Knights of Favonius. Its shaft is straight, and its tip flows lightly like the wind.

customize.name: Makhaira Aquamarine
customize.desc: An ancient greatsword that gleams like the waters themselves. A thousand years of sand erosion has not dulled its unnaturally sharp edge one bit.

customize.name: Mistsplitter Reforged
customize.desc: A sword that blazes with a fierce violet light. The name "Reforged" comes from it having been broken once before.

customize.name: Calamity Queller
customize.desc: A keenly honed weapon forged from some strange crystal. Its faint blue light seems to whisper of countless matters now past.

customize.name: Favonius Warbow
customize.desc: A standard-issue recurve bow of the Knights of Favonius. Only the best archers can unleash its full potential.

customize.name: Sacrificial Sword
customize.desc: A ceremonial sword that has become petrified over time. The trinkets on it are still visible. It grants the wielder the power to withstand the winds of time.

customize.name: Wine and Song
customize.desc: A songbook from the bygone aristocratic era, whose composer has become forgotten. It chronicles the tale of a certain heroic outlaw.

customize.name: Favonius Lance
customize.desc: A polearm made in the style of the Knights of Favonius. Its shaft is straight, and its tip flows lightly like the wind.

customize.name: The Bell
customize.desc: A heavy greatsword. A clock is embedded within it, though its internal mechanisms have long been damaged.

customize.name: Calamity Queller
customize.desc: A keenly honed weapon forged from some strange crystal. Its faint blue light seems to whisper of countless matters now past.

customize.name: Primordial Jade Winged-Spear
customize.desc: A jade polearm made by the archons, capable of slaying ancient beasts.

customize.name: Favonius Warbow
customize.desc: A standard-issue recurve bow of the Knights of Favonius. Only the best archers can unleash its full potential.

customize.name: The Flute
customize.desc: Beneath its rusty exterior is a lavishly decorated thin blade. It swings as swiftly as the wind.

customize.name: The Widsith
customize.desc: A heavy notebook filled with musical scores. Though suffering from moth damage and heavy wear-and-tear, there is still much power to be found among the hand-written words within.

customize.name: Lithic Spear
customize.desc: A spear forged from the rocks of the Guyun Stone Forest. Its hardness knows no equal.

customize.name: Favonius Greatsword
customize.desc: A heavy ceremonial sword of the Knights of Favonius. It channels elemental power easily and is highly destructive.

materials.name: Mora
materials.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

materials.name: Mist Veiled Lead Elixir
materials.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
Jueyun Karst is the realm of the mighty and illuminated adepti. But other than the ability to control the elements of the world, Jueyun Karst is also home to three other untold secrets: Alchemy, Sigils, and Sub-Space Creation.

materials.name: Mist Grass Pollen
materials.desc: Strange spores created by Mist Grass in enclosed spaces. They are the Cicins' favorite food.

materials.name: Whopperflower Nectar
materials.desc:
Nectar extracted from the stamen of a Whopperflower that contains trace amounts of elemental energy.
The taste of the nectar has a hint of Sweet Flower in it.

materials.name: Mora
materials.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

materials.name: Mist Veiled Mercury Elixir
materials.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
With Fulu (Sigils), the adepti can store their power in the form of symbols, and with Waijing (Sub-Space Creation) they can fashion a cosmic paradise with the power of their minds. The manufacture of elixirs, however, has always been shrouded in mystery, for certain death follows for any who swallow them.

materials.name: Mist Grass Pollen
materials.desc: Strange spores created by Mist Grass in enclosed spaces. They are the Cicins' favorite food.

materials.name: Whopperflower Nectar
materials.desc:
Nectar extracted from the stamen of a Whopperflower that contains trace amounts of elemental energy.
The taste of the nectar has a hint of Sweet Flower in it.

materials.name: Mora
materials.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

materials.name: Mist Veiled Mercury Elixir
materials.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
With Fulu (Sigils), the adepti can store their power in the form of symbols, and with Waijing (Sub-Space Creation) they can fashion a cosmic paradise with the power of their minds. The manufacture of elixirs, however, has always been shrouded in mystery, for certain death follows for any who swallow them.

materials.name: Mist Grass
materials.desc: Well-preserved Mist Grass. Some would take advantage of the Cicins' love for the Mist Grass to control them.

materials.name: Shimmering Nectar
materials.desc:
Nectar that is full of pure elemental energy.
Scholars generally concur that Whopperflowers are advanced life forms among the elemental plants, but there has yet to be a satisfactory explanation regarding their predatory habits.

materials.name: Mora
materials.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

materials.name: Mist Veiled Gold Elixir
materials.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
Elixirs are in fact pills made from metal alloys. They were created by the adepti, and are able to grant weapons transcendent powers. However, they are rarely seen in the world due to the hubris of the practitioners of martial arts, who prized the ways of combat over the paths of the adepti.

materials.name: Mist Grass
materials.desc: Well-preserved Mist Grass. Some would take advantage of the Cicins' love for the Mist Grass to control them.

materials.name: Shimmering Nectar
materials.desc:
Nectar that is full of pure elemental energy.
Scholars generally concur that Whopperflowers are advanced life forms among the elemental plants, but there has yet to be a satisfactory explanation regarding their predatory habits.

materials.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

materials.desc:

Elixirs are in fact pills made from metal alloys. They were created by the adepti, and are able to grant weapons transcendent powers. However, they are rarely seen in the world due to the hubris of the practitioners of martial arts, who prized the ways of combat over the paths of the adepti.

materials.name: Mist Grass Wick
materials.desc: A rare bundle of Mist Grass that gives off a faint glow. Those who carry it invite both the Cicins and misfortune.

materials.name: Energy Nectar
materials.desc:
A thick and sticky honey that is full of energy.
The Whopperflower hunts by tricking its prey, a process it uses to possibly evolve into a more powerful and pure form.

materials.name: Mora
materials.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

materials.name: Mist Veiled Primo Elixir
materials.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
An elixir of the highest quality. It embodies a state of intertwining order and chaos, and is said to mirror how the world was when it was first created. Of course, a certain someone knows that this was not the case.

materials.name: Mist Grass Wick
materials.desc: A rare bundle of Mist Grass that gives off a faint glow. Those who carry it invite both the Cicins and misfortune.

materials.name: Energy Nectar
materials.desc:
A thick and sticky honey that is full of energy.
The Whopperflower hunts by tricking its prey, a process it uses to possibly evolve into a more powerful and pure form.

desc.text:
They say that this long polearm was forged using materials that are not from this world.
The weapon has passed through the hands of many loyal yet unfortunate souls.
It has seen many a slaughter begin and end, and tasted many a foul beast's flesh and blood.
It is said that a person whose job was to exorcise evil once came to the great chasm of crystal sands.
There, they retrieved an ominous, aqua-colored crystal from its depths.
Then, they hired someone to forge it into a weapon, naming it "Calamity Queller."
"If disaster should befall, this shall surely be used to calm it."
The tribespeople who made their living in the craggy mountains were not partial to either boasts or critique.
But since there was no contract signed, and such words were of no cost, they accepted them all the same.
Later, the time came when the monstrous tides scaled the bedrock, turning the cinnabar-colored earth black.
The shield-wall of the Millelith and the dark forces clashed, and any stragglers were all slain.
Like a cold star amidst the gloom, Calamity Queller flashed this way and that at the heart of the maelstrom...
When, at last, the light of the setting sun split the mournful clouds, the dark sludge sunk back into the depths of the chasm.
The Calamity Queller was also lost, together with the Yaksha who wielded it — both returned to silence.
In times thereafter, those who wielded this spear would largely meet similar fates.
But there were people who would fight without requiring orders or protect people without taking any oaths.
For them, such a fate was hardly one to be lamented...
It is also said that this spear was once borrowed from someone.
And in a deserted, water-eroded cave, it would bear witness to a clash between intimate friends.

value.text: Gain <color=#37ffff>12%/15%/18%/21%/24%</color> All Elemental DMG Bonus. Obtain Consummation for 20s after using an Elemental Skill, causing ATK to increase by <color=#37ffff>3.2%/4%/4.8%/5.6%/6.4%</color> per second. This ATK increase has a maximum of 6 stacks. When the character equipped with this weapon is not on the field, Consummation's ATK increase is doubled.
